# Anwar Hamed

Anwar Hamed (born 1957) () is a Palestinian novelist and poet. He was born in Anabta, Palestine, and went to Hungary for college. His first short stories were published in Arabic when he was still a teenager in the West Bank, but after his move to Hungary, he started writing in Hungarian. His first novels were written in this language. Since 2004, he has been living in London, where he worked for BBC Arabic
between 2004 and 2024. He published over a hundred articles on BBCArabic website, mostly in the field of Arts and Culture.
His short story entitled “The Key”, published in English, was longlisted to British Science Fiction Association Award 2019. The short film based on this story , directd by Rakan Mayasi, was shown in several American, European and Arab film festivals and cinemas.
His most recent novel is أشباه وأشباح, which was published in Arabic in  2023.
His novel Jaffa Prepares Morning Coffee was longlisted for the 2013 Arabic Booker Prize.
